page.title: 16"OUR SCHOOL"IN THE PAST
page.content: WE INTERVIEWED MR. KIERNAN WHO IS A TEACHER IN SACRED HEART SCHOOL. HE WAS ONCE A PUPIL HERE. WHEN HE STARTED AT THIS SCHOOL IN 1960 HE WAS IN PRIMARY 7 AND THERE WERE FEW PUPILS. IN PRIMARIES 5 AND 6 THERE WERE ONLY ABOUT 10 CHILDREN. THERE WAS ONLY ONE TEACHER, MR. FRAZER, WHO HAD BEEN HEADMASTER FOR 6 MONTHS. ANOTHER TEACHER CAME IN ABOUT 2 MONTHS. THERE WERE NO TRIPS ABROAD, AND ONLY A FOOTBALL CLUB WHICH WAS MADE UP FROM PRIMARIES 5,6 & 7. THEY DID NOT HAVE A JANITOR FOR MOST OF THE DAY SINCE HE LIVED IN DUMBARTON AND HAD TO TRAVEL TO SCHOOL EVERY DAY. THE PRIMARY 7 PUPILS HAD TO HELP CARRY IN DESKS AND STAMP BOOKS. THERE WAS HARDLY ANY EQUIPMENT IN THE SCHOOL BUT EACH PUPIL HAD PENCILS, RULERS ETC. THE CHILDREN THOUGHT THAT THE RULES WERE VERY STRICT THEN.
